newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Direct sales challenge S.African insurance brokers.
newsitem.headline: Direct sales challenge S.African insurance brokers.

text.p: Direct marketing by insurers is a growing threat to South African brokers, according to the country's largest independent short-term broker.

Brian Peck, managing director of Prestasi Brokers, part of Prestasi Financial Services Ltd, told the annual Short-Term Insurance Congress that direct marketing -- especially tele-sales -- was gaining ground worldwide.
"In the UK and the Netherlands, direct telephone sales now account for 15 and 25 percent respectively of personal lines sales," he said.
The same pattern was emerging in South Africa and brokers had to follow suit if they wanted to retain their role in the insurance distribution chain.
"The brokerage industry can combat insurers' use of direct marketing only if brokers themselves begin using the best possible direct marketing techniques," Peck said.
